Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our main character at the age of 18 (youth). Miyazawa is the author of various works, but was most famous for the Japanese publications The Hatred of Suicide, Roji, Fire That Crawl, and so forth.

This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africans. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The movie is as dark and depressing as it needs to be to convey its message. It is what it is made out to be, and I love it for that fact.
